summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, primarily from August 9-11, 2019. It includes official count sheets, inmate rosters, out-count forms, and a daily log. The records show inmate population counts, housing unit assignments, and movements. Most significantly, the inmate roster lists Jeffrey Epstein as an inmate with a 'PRE' (pretrial) status, housed in a specific unit (Z04A). This document contains Bureau of Prisons psychological assessments for Jeffrey Epstein conducted on July 8-10, 2019, while he was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM). It includes a Risk of Sexual Abusiveness evaluation, a Suicide Risk Assessment, and administrative notes. The assessments document Epstein's psychological state, risk factors, and his denial of suicidal ideation shortly before his death. This document contains a series of Bureau of Prisons psychology service records for Jeffrey Epstein from July 9-24, 2019, while he was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM). It includes suicide risk assessments, clinical intervention notes, and administrative notes documenting his mental health status, denial of suicidality, complaints about prison conditions, and the July 23 incident where he was found with a string around his neck, leading to suicide watch. This document contains a series of Bureau of Prisons psychology reports detailing Jeffrey Epstein's mental status and suicide risk assessment following an incident in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where he was found with marks on his neck. The reports cover his removal from suicide watch, placement on psychological observation, his claims of memory loss regarding the incident, and his complaints about prison conditions. This document contains a series of Bureau of Prisons psychology service clinical notes and assessments for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July 27 to August 1, 2019, while he was held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The notes detail his mental status, complaints about conditions in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), the incident of neck injuries on July 23, his competency evaluation for a disciplinary process, and his eventual return to SHU. This document contains Bureau of Prisons records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration, including a psychological evaluation, clinical encounter, and incident report detailing a possible suicide attempt on July 23, 2019. It includes staff observations, medical assessments, and a daily roster of prison staff. This document appears to be a staff shift log or roster for a correctional facility, dated July 23, 2019. It details officer assignments, status changes (e.g., sick leave, annual leave), shift reliefs, and overtime entries for various posts within the facility. This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, primarily concerning Jeffrey Epstein's detention and death. It includes an administrative detention order placing Epstein in protective custody, a memo detailing a prior suicide attempt and allegations against his cellmate, a detailed timeline of his suicide on August 10, 2019, and various count sheets, rosters, and evidence logs. The records show internal procedures, staff assignments, and the immediate response to Epstein's death. This document is a compilation of Federal Bureau of Prisons administrative logs, check sheets, and inmate records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 9-10, 2019. It includes detailed shift logs for the Special Housing Unit (SHU), 30-minute inmate observation check sheets, and inmate history and deposit records for Jeffrey Epstein. The logs show routine prison operations and cell checks in the SHU during the period just before Epstein's death. This document is a Bureau of Prisons investigative report concerning an incident on July 23, 2019, where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a homemade noose around his neck. It includes staff observations, medical assessments, and interviews with Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, concluding there was insufficient evidence of an assault and recommending no separation. It also contains related emails about suicide watch status and a financial account summary for Epstein. This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons records related to Jeffrey Epstein's detention at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in July 2019. It includes an administrative detention order placing him in protective custody, a detailed incident report of a self-mutilation/suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, a health services clinical encounter documenting his injuries and statements, segregation logs, and an investigative report summarizing interviews with Epstein and his cellmate regarding the incident. This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons records from July 2019 concerning Jeffrey Epstein's detention at MCC New York. It includes an administrative detention order, an incident report for self-mutilation, medical assessments following an event where Epstein was found with a homemade noose, and investigative interviews with Epstein and his cellmate. The records detail injuries, medical complaints, and the official conclusion that there was insufficient evidence of assault. This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering his medical encounters, vitals, diagnoses, and treatment plans from July 7, 2019, to August 10, 2019, while he was held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM). It details his chronic health conditions, medical evaluations, and scheduled care, ending just before his death. This document contains Bureau of Prisons health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, including a clinical encounter, administrative notes, a history & physical, and medical duty status forms from July-August 2019. It details his medical complaints, assessments, treatments, and prescribed accommodations while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July to August 2019, including medication summaries, dental exams, lab results, and treatment refusal forms. It details his medical conditions, prescribed medications, and his refusal of certain recommended evaluations while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July to August 2019. It includes treatment refusal forms, dental examinations, and detailed clinical encounter notes documenting his health complaints and the emergency response to his cardiac arrest on August 10, 2019. This document contains Bureau of Prisons records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, detailing Jeffrey Epstein's psychological intake assessment, a reported suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and his subsequent death by suicide on August 10, 2019. It includes incident reports, medical notes, and photo sheets documenting both events. This document contains Bureau of Prisons psychological service records for Jeffrey Epstein from July 8-10, 2019, including a suicide risk assessment and administrative notes. It details his mental state, risk factors, and the prison's precautionary measures following a court proceeding, concluding his acute suicide risk was low. This document contains a series of Bureau of Prisons psychology service notes for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July 9-24, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It details his mental health assessments, suicide risk evaluations, and daily observations while in custody, culminating in a suicide watch after he was found with a string around his neck on July 23. A series of Bureau of Prisons psychology reports documenting Jeffrey Epstein's mental status and suicide risk assessments following an incident in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where he was found with a neck injury. The reports cover his placement on and removal from suicide watch, his consistent denial of memory regarding the injury, his complaints about SHU conditions, and his interactions with staff and legal team. This document is a Bureau of Prisons Special Housing Unit (SHU) weekly review from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8, 2019. It lists inmates in the SHU, including Jeffrey Epstein, and details the reasons for their placement, such as pending investigations, disciplinary hearings, and specific incidents. It notably records Epstein's placement following a suicide attempt on July 23, 2019. This document contains Bureau of Prisons administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, primarily from July 2019. It includes inmate disciplinary reports, a daily staff roster, and multiple detailed memoranda describing the July 23, 2019, incident where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found with a makeshift rope around his neck in his cell. The memoranda provide conflicting accounts from Epstein, who later claimed his cellmate tried to kill and extort him. This document set includes a memorandum announcing an After Action Review team to investigate the apparent suicide of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York, a formal letter from the Warden notifying the court of Epstein's death, an email from a staff member about a recent visit with Epstein, and a detailed psychology department response outlining procedural changes following the incident. The documents collectively focus on the immediate aftermath and internal review of Epstein's death in custody. This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons 24-hour death report and related notifications concerning the death of inmate Jeffery Edward Epstein on August 10, 2019. The document details the clinical synopsis of events leading to his death, including his placement on and removal from suicide watch, and the official preliminary cause of death is listed as alleged suicide. This document is a Bureau of Prisons 24-hour death notification for inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein, followed by his official autopsy report from the NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner. It details the timeline of his death on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, his transport to the hospital, and the subsequent autopsy findings which concluded the cause of death was hanging and the manner was suicide. This document contains the official autopsy report, toxicology report, neuropathology report, and anthropology report for Jeffrey Edward Epstein, performed after his death in custody on August 10, 2019. The autopsy details injuries consistent with hanging, including ligature furrow and fractures to the hyoid and thyroid cartilage. Toxicology reports show no drugs of abuse detected. The reports are signed by the examining medical professionals. This document contains Bureau of Prisons medical records for Jeffrey Epstein from July-August 2019, including multiple treatment refusal forms, dental examinations, chronic care clinic notes, and a detailed emergency resuscitation report from August 10, 2019, documenting his cardiac arrest and death. The records show Epstein refused several medical evaluations while in custody. This document is a series of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Health Services clinical encounter notes for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July 23-30, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York (NYM). It details his medical complaints, including a neck injury he insinuated was caused by his roommate, episodes of right arm numbness and weakness, and his general health status. The records show evaluations by medical staff, medication orders, and referrals. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering medical encounters from July 7 to July 23, 2019. The most significant entry details a clinical encounter on July 23, 2019, where Epstein was examined after being found in his cell with a rope around his neck, showing a circular line of erythema. He was placed on suicide watch. Other records detail routine chronic care visits for conditions like hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, and back pain. This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July 7, 2019, to August 10, 2019. It includes detailed medical encounter notes, vital signs, medication orders, health problem diagnoses, and transfer preparation documents from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The records show Epstein was under medical supervision for various conditions prior to his death. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering his medical duty status, medication history, dental exams, and lab results from July to August 2019 while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details his medical restrictions, prescribed medications for various conditions, and results of routine health screenings. This document is a series of suicide watch observation logs for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July 23-25, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York). The logs contain handwritten, often illegible, observations by correctional staff documenting Epstein's status and activities in 15-minute intervals. The logs were created in the days leading up to his death. This document is a compilation of internal Bureau of Prisons records detailing the timeline of Jeffrey Epstein's death by suicide on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, and the subsequent institutional response and psychological reconstruction. It includes minute-by-minute logs of the incident, notifications, staff actions, and post-mortem memos addressing procedural failures and corrective actions. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative records from the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) concerning inmate Efrain Reyes (Reg. No. 85993-054). It includes his administrative detention order, inmate profile, and Special Housing Unit (SHU) review forms, showing he was placed in administrative detention pending an SIS investigation/threat assessment. A later SHU weekly review report lists numerous other inmates in the SHU, including Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054), for whom a note mandates 30-minute rounds. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons memoranda and an incident report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, detailing psychological observations of Jeffrey Epstein from July 8 to August 10, 2019, and reporting his death on August 10, 2019. It includes psychological assessments, a memo about a social phone call, a death notification memo, and the official Form 583 Report of Incident. This document contains multiple Bureau of Prisons memoranda and a clinical encounter form detailing the medical emergency, resuscitation attempts, and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It includes accounts from various staff members responding to the incident and subsequent procedures. This document is a collection of administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, primarily from July 23-24, 2019, and includes a memorandum from August 10, 2019. It consists of staff rosters, inmate rosters, official count sheets, out-count forms, and count slips. The records detail inmate population counts, staff assignments, and a specific memorandum regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's phone call to his family on August 9, 2019.

events.description: Inmate Robert Clark (53358-054) is documented as being out-counted for a 'FNYS' (Federal New York South) assignment at 4:00 PM.

events.title: Inmate Attorney Visit and Out-Counts
events.description: Records show inmate Claudius English was scheduled for an attorney visit ('ATTY'). Multiple out-count forms were prepared for various housing units.

events.title: Epstein's Court Proceeding and Intake Screening
events.description: Epstein had a court proceeding. Upon his return to the MCC, he underwent an intake screening and was assessed for risk of sexual abusiveness. He was placed on psychological observation as a precaution.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Dr. Elissa Miller conducted a formal suicide risk assessment on Epstein. He was found to be at low acute risk, denied any suicidal ideation, and was future-oriented, mentioning an upcoming bail hearing.

events.title: Risk of Sexual Abusiveness Assessment
events.description: Psychology provider K. Schlessinger assessed Epstein and identified him as being at risk for sexual abusiveness due to prior sexual abuse perpetration in the community and prior violent offense convictions. He was judged to be at low risk within the facility.

events.title: Assessment Amendment
events.description: Dr. Elissa Miller amended the suicide risk assessment note from the previous day.

events.title: Initial Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Epstein undergoes precautionary suicide risk assessment after returning from court, is found to have low acute and chronic suicide risk, and is placed on psychological observation.

events.title: Clinical Intervention and Housing
events.description: Epstein is seen for psychological observation contact, expresses numerous complaints about prison conditions, and is released from observation to be housed in 9S area with a cellmate.

events.title: String Incident and Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein found with a string loosely hanging around his neck at approximately 2 AM, placed on suicide watch. He claims not to remember the incident, and medical notes a circular line around his neck.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment After Incident
events.description: Imeri conducts suicide risk assessment, notes Epstein denies memory of string incident, reports throat pain, and states his cellmate tried to kill him (per staff log). Acute suicide risk assessed as moderate.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch following an incident in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where he was found with marks (a significant scar) around his neck.

events.title: Removal from Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was stepped down from Suicide Watch to Psychological Observation after a risk assessment found his overall acute suicide risk to be 'Low' and chronic risk 'Absent'. He adamantly denied suicidal ideation.

events.title: Psychological Observation Period
events.description: Epstein remained on Psychological Observation, with daily psychology contacts, following the neck injury incident. He continued to claim no memory of the event and expressed fear about returning to the SHU.

events.title: Bail Denial
events.description: The report notes Epstein was recently denied bail, which is listed as a contextual stressor and risk factor in his psychological assessment.

events.title: Neck Injury Incident in SHU
events.description: Epstein was found with marks on his neck in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), leading to an incident report for tattooing or self-mutilation (code 228). He consistently stated he could not remember how the injuries occurred.

events.title: Psychological Observation Period
events.description: Epstein was placed on psychological observation following the neck injury incident. He was seen daily by psychology staff who assessed his mental status, sleep issues, and complaints about SHU conditions.

events.title: Competency Evaluation for Disciplinary Process
events.description: Epstein was evaluated by Dr. Imeri for competency to proceed with the disciplinary process regarding the July 23 incident report. He was found competent.

events.title: Return to SHU and Court Hearing
events.description: Epstein was returned to SHU and reported going to court for a status hearing. He reported adjusting and getting along with his cellmate.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment After Marshal's Form
events.description: A suicide risk assessment was conducted after R&D staff reported US Marshals had Epstein sign a form noting 'suicidal tendencies' upon his return from court. Epstein denied being suicidal.

events.title: Possible Suicide Attempt in SHU
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his SHU cell (124) with an orange homemade rope around his neck, unresponsive but breathing. His cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, alerted staff. Epstein was removed from the cell and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Medical Examination After Incident
events.description: Epstein was examined by medical provider Y. Joaquin. He claimed not to know what happened, had a circular line of erythema on his neck, and was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Psychological Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Psychologist Darlene Imeri evaluated Epstein. He denied suicidal ideation, was found psychologically stable with protective factors overriding risk factors, and suicide watch was not indicated.

events.title: Follow-up Psychological Session
events.description: Chief Psychologist Elissa Miller saw Epstein for a follow-up in SHU. He denied suicidal ideation or mental health symptoms, complained about prison conditions, and spent time with his attorneys.

events.title: Officer Status Change
events.description: Officer V. McDermott's status is changed to 'Sick / Annual' and later marked as 'Removed'.

events.title: Multiple Shift Changes
events.description: Numerous officer shift changes, status updates (Annual Leave, Sick Leave, LWOP), and overtime entries are logged.

events.title: Continued Staff Logging
events.description: Further officer status updates and overtime entries are recorded.

events.title: Widespread Shift Activity
events.description: Extensive logging of officer assignments, reliefs, status changes, and overtime across many facility posts.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is placed in Administrative Detention at MCC New York for his own protection, pending classification.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt and Allegations
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, Epstein is found in his cell with a noose around his neck, unresponsive. After revival, he alleges his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione tried to kill him and extort money.

events.title: Epstein's Cellmate Departs for Court
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes, Epstein's cellmate, departs MCC for court (WAB-USMS-SDNY) at 8:00 am.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide and Death
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm is activated. Staff find Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR is initiated, EMS arrives, and he is transported to Beekman Hospital. He is pronounced dead at 7:36 am by an ER physician.

events.title: Notifications and Investigations Begin
events.description: Following Epstein's death, numerous entities are notified including USMS, SIS, FBI, AUSA, Judge Berman, next of kin, OIG, and the media. Evidence collection begins.

events.title: OIG and FBI Evidence Collection
events.description: OIG Agents John Kerwin and Guido Modano arrive at MCC, collect two computers from the SHU, and depart.

events.title: Inmate Rape Allegation Drop Note
events.description: Inmate Espinal submits a drop note alleging he was raped. He is immediately escorted to medical.

events.title: SHU Day Shift Logs
events.description: Routine prison operations in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York, including shift changes, inmate counts, and security checks.

events.title: SHU Evening Shift Logs and Inmate Checks
events.description: Continuation of routine prison operations in the SHU, including 30-minute inmate observation checks as per protocol for inmates in locked-down status.

events.title: Epstein Housing Assignment Change
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was moved to housing assignment NYM Z04-206LAD (House Z, Range 04, Bed 206L AD) at 07:34.

events.title: Epstein's Housing History
events.description: Log of Jeffrey Epstein's multiple housing assignment changes within MCC New York over approximately a month.

events.title: Inmate Investigative Report Review
events.description: BOP investigative report (NYM-19-0081) involving inmates Epstein and Tartaglione was reviewed and signed by investigator, captain, associate warden, and warden.

events.title: Epstein Found with Homemade Noose
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein lying on his cell floor in a fetal position with a homemade noose around his neck. He was breathing heavily and responsive. He was restrained, medically examined, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Interviews of Epstein and Tartaglione
events.description: SIS staff interviewed Epstein and his cellmate Tartaglione separately about the July 23 incident. Epstein claimed exhaustion and lack of memory; Tartaglione described finding Epstein and calling for help.

events.title: Epstein Charged with Self-Mutilation
events.description: Staff wrote an incident report charging Epstein with code 228 - Self Mutilation following the discovery of the noose.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: Per an email from Samantha DiMisa, Epstein was removed from Suicide Watch and stepped down to Psychological Observation.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt / Self-Mutilation Incident
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, Epstein is found in his SHU cell with a homemade orange rope around his neck, unresponsive but breathing. His cellmate Tartaglione alerts staff. Epstein is resuscitated, removed from the cell, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Investigative Interviews Conducted
events.description: Lieutenant Tijuana Doctor separately interviews Epstein and Tartaglione about the July 23 incident. Epstein claims sleep deprivation and amnesia. Tartaglione provides his account and reveals tense conversations with Epstein, including Epstein stating 'fourteen (14) is legal in most states.'

events.title: Incident Report for Self Mutilation
events.description: Staff wrote an incident report for Jeffrey Epstein for code 228 - Self Mutilation, related to the noose incident.

events.title: Initial Medical Assessment
events.description: A medical assessment was conducted on Epstein by Joaquin, Y. MLP, identifying a circular line of erythema and friction marks on his neck and a small erythema on his left knee.

events.title: Epstein Insinuates Cellmate Involvement
events.description: During a follow-up medical visit, Epstein told MLP Joaquin, 'I think my room mate had to do with what happened to me,' but refused to elaborate further.

events.title: Epstein Reports Neurological Symptoms
events.description: Epstein reported to RN Columbo that he woke up with no control over his right arm and had ongoing tingling/numbness (neuropathy).

events.title: SIS Interviews with Epstein and Tartaglione
events.description: SIS Staff separately interviewed Epstein and Tartaglione. Epstein stated he was extremely tired, heard himself snoring, and had no issues with Tartaglione. Tartaglione described finding Epstein, stated Epstein made him uncomfortable with a comment about age of consent, and said he did not want to be involved in any plots.

events.title: Investigation Conclusion - No Assault Evidence
events.description: Based on the investigation, it was concluded there was insufficient evidence to support that Epstein was assaulted by Tartaglione. No separations were warranted.

events.title: Initial Comprehensive Medical Encounter
events.description: Epstein underwent a detailed physical examination by MLP Joaquin, documenting vitals, health history, and identifying constipation. A PPD test was read as negative.

events.title: Chronic Care Evaluation for Pain
events.description: Epstein reported severe back pain (scale 5) with shooting pain and numbness in lower extremities, diagnosed with low back pain and neuralgia. A Medrol dose pack was prescribed.

events.title: Chronic Care Physician Evaluation
events.description: Dr. Beaudouin evaluated Epstein for endocrine/lipid issues, sleep apnea, and back pain. Medications (Vascepa) were continued and lab tests were ordered.

events.title: Medical Encounter and Cosign
events.description: Epstein was seen by MLP Joaquin in the morning, with the encounter later cosigned by Dr. Beaudouin. An 'injury, unspecified' was documented with a note 'R/O self inflicted injuries.'

events.title: Preparation for Hospital Transfer
events.description: Nurse Joseph Colombo generated an 'Inmate Local Hospital' transfer form summarizing all of Epstein's health problems, medications, pending appointments, and restrictions. This was the final medical document generated before his death.

events.title: Epstein Intake History & Physical
events.description: Epstein undergoes a comprehensive medical intake examination by MLP Y. Joaquin at the MCC. He reports extensive travel history and sexual history.

events.title: Epstein Clinical Encounter for Chronic Care
events.description: Epstein is evaluated by Dr. Robert Beaudouin for multiple chronic conditions including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, and severe lower back pain. Medications are prescribed.

events.title: CPAP Machine Authorization
events.description: A CPAP machine for sleep apnea is officially authorized for Epstein's use in his cell, with serial number recorded.

events.title: Blood Collection for Lab Tests
events.description: Blood was drawn from Epstein for comprehensive metabolic panel, hematology, and serology tests.

events.title: Refusal of Chest X-Ray
events.description: Epstein refused a routine chest X-ray recommended by BOP medical staff.

events.title: Dental Health Assessment
events.description: Epstein underwent a dental health history screening and A&O examination, revealing several health issues and conditions.

events.title: Refusal of Eye Doctor Evaluation
events.description: Epstein refused a recommended eye doctor evaluation on multiple forms dated July 24, 2019.

events.title: Epstein refuses chest X-ray
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein refuses a recommended routine chest X-ray, signing a Medical Treatment Refusal form after being counseled by provider S. Esguerra.

events.title: Epstein refuses eye doctor evaluation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein refuses a recommended eye doctor evaluation, signing a Medical Treatment Refusal form after being counseled by Dr. Robert Beaudouin.

events.title: Chronic care evaluation
events.description: Dr. Robert Beaudouin evaluates Epstein, who reports being without medications for a week, numbness in his right arm, sleep apnea due to lack of CPAP, and other health issues. New medications and tests are ordered.

events.title: Epstein's cardiac arrest and resuscitation
events.description: Emergency response to Epstein found unresponsive in his cell. Correctional officers and medical staff, including RN Joseph Columbo and paramedics, perform CPR, administer medications, and intubate him before transport to a local ER.

events.title: Psychological Intake Screening
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein undergoes a psychological intake screening at MCC. He denies any mental health history, suicidal ideation, or substance abuse. He is assessed as low risk for sexual abusiveness and Care Level 1 (no need for regular mental health intervention).

events.title: Reported Suicide Attempt / Incident
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, a call for assistance is made from Epstein's cell. He is found lying on the floor, with a red neck, snoring. He is placed on suicide watch. He later accuses his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, of attempting to kill him. Tartaglione claims he found Epstein with a string around his neck. Medical examination later finds marks on Epstein's neck and knee.

events.title: Medical Note Amendment
events.description: Dr. Robert Bortndouin makes an amendment to a Bureau of Prisons Health Services note regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 AM, Jeffrey Epstein is found deceased in his cell at MCC. The incident is classified as an 'INMATE SUICIDE'. Extensive photographs of the scene and his body are taken by Lt. S. Jean and others.

events.title: Court Proceeding and Precautionary Placement
events.description: Epstein attended a court proceeding which could have given him 'bad news' regarding his legal situation. Upon returning to jail after duty hours, he was placed on precautionary psychological observation status.

events.title: Consultation on Epstein's Risk
events.description: Dr. Miller consulted with Central Office psychologist Dr. Robert Nagle regarding Epstein's various risk factors for suicidality.

events.title: Upcoming Bail Hearing
events.description: Epstein reported to the psychologist that he was going to have a bail hearing on Monday and believed he was going to be released from jail.

events.title: Psychological Observation Contact
events.description: Epstein is seen in the hospital area, voices numerous complaints about his conditions, and discusses his upcoming bail hearing.

events.title: Epstein placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is placed on Suicide Watch following an incident in the SHU where he is found with a significant scar/scabbing around his neck. The exact cause is unclear.

events.title: Daily Psychological Observations
events.description: A series of daily clinical contacts by prison psychologists (DiMisa, Miller, Imeri) with Epstein while he is on Psychological Observation. He consistently denies suicidal ideation, complains about SHU conditions, and maintains he cannot remember the neck injury incident.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a homemade rope around his neck in an apparent suicide attempt.

events.title: Health Services Note Amendment
events.description: Dr. Darlene Imeri amended a Bureau of Prisons Health Services note regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Cellphone Recovery Incident
events.description: SIS recovered a cellphone on top of inmate Lorenzo Babrow's locker, implicating both Babrow and Jamal Brissett, leading to their placement in SHU.

events.title: SHU Weekly Review Compiled
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons Special Housing Unit weekly review document was generated, listing all inmates in SHU and their statuses as of this date.

events.title: Epstein Found with Rope Around Neck
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his Special Housing Unit cell with a homemade orange rope around his neck. He was unresponsive but breathing. Staff intervened, removed the rope, performed chest compressions, and transported him to a medical unit.

events.title: Epstein Accuses Cellmate of Murder Attempt and Extortion
events.description: After becoming responsive, Epstein told Officer D. Clarke that he believed his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, tried to kill him and had been trying to extort money from him for a week, threatening to beat him up.

events.title: Inmate Smith Found with Drugs
events.description: Inmate Brandon Smith was found in possession of a green leafy substance that tested positive for amphetamine during a visual search.

events.title: Inmate Tartaglione Found with Cell Phone
events.description: Inmate Nicholas Tartaglione was found in possession of a cell phone during a pat search. He was later sanctioned.

events.title: Last recorded visit with Epstein
events.description: Staff member Elissa Visoky visited Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). He was with a cellmate, showed no signs of distress, denied suicidal thoughts, and was preparing to meet with his attorneys.

events.title: After Action Review Team Arrival
events.description: A team of BOP staff was scheduled to arrive at MCC New York to perform an After Action Review of the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Special Housing Unit
events.description: Epstein was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cell mate.

events.title: Psychology Services Evaluation
events.description: Epstein was seen by Psychology Services and denied suicidal ideation, intention, or plan.

events.title: Death of Jeffery Edward Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 a.m., SHU staff found Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR was initiated, EMS was called, and he was transported to New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital where he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. by the ER Physician.

events.title: Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was taken off suicide watch and placed on Psychological Observation.

events.title: Placed in Special Housing Unit
events.description: Epstein was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cellmate.

events.title: Autopsy Performed
events.description: Autopsy performed by Dr. Kristin Roman at the Manhattan Mortuary, commencing at 9:21 AM.

events.title: Autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The autopsy of Jeffrey Edward Epstein is performed by Dr. Kristin Roman at the New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner.

events.title: Neuropathology Examination
events.description: Dr. Rebecca Folkerth, with Dr. Kristin Roman in attendance, performs the macroscopic neuropathologic examination of Epstein's brain and spinal cord.

events.title: Anthropology Report Completed
events.description: Dr. Angela So completes the forensic anthropology report detailing fractures to Epstein's hyoid bone and thyroid cartilage.

events.title: Final Toxicology Report Issued
events.description: NMS Labs issues its final toxicology report, certified by Sherri L Kacinko, finding no synthetic cannabinoids or other drugs of toxicological significance in Epstein's femoral blood.

events.title: Autopsy Report Signed
events.description: Dr. Kristin Roman electronically signs the completed autopsy report, which was reviewed by Dr. Jason K. Graham.

events.title: Epstein refuses eye evaluation
events.description: Epstein signed multiple treatment refusal forms declining recommended eye doctor evaluations, counseled by Dr. Robert Beaudouin.

events.title: Dental examination
events.description: Epstein received an initial clinical dental examination at MCC New York conducted by Chief Dental Officer C. Ancrum.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive and dies
events.description: At approximately 06:35, correctional officers found Epstein unresponsive in his cell with 'circumferential bruising around the neck and posterior mottling.' CPR was initiated, EMS was called, and he was transported to a local ER with CPR in progress after extensive resuscitation efforts documented by RN Joseph Columbo.

events.title: Epstein's Neck Injury Incident
events.description: Epstein is evaluated for an injury. He states he 'went to drink a little water and wake up snorting' and is found with erythema and abrasion on his neck. He does not explain how it happened.

events.title: Epstein Implicates Roommate to Medical Staff
events.description: During a follow-up for his neck injury, Epstein tells MLP Joaquin, 'I think my room mate had to do with what happened to me.' He refuses to say anything more. This statement is subsequently notified to the Operations Lieutenant (OP LT) by medical staff.

events.title: Epstein Reports Right Arm Numbness/Loss of Control
events.description: Epstein reports to nursing staff that he woke up with no control over his right arm for a few minutes. He later reports numbness in his right arm that lasted 2-3 minutes, which was concerning to him.

events.title: Comprehensive Medical Evaluation
events.description: Dr. Beaudouin conducts a chronic care clinic encounter with Epstein. Epstein reports being without his medications for about a week, the right arm numbness episode, and an inability to sleep for 3 weeks due to lack of access to his CPAP machine. New medications and lab/radiology tests are ordered.

events.title: Initial Health Services Intake
events.description: Epstein underwent a comprehensive initial health assessment upon intake at the BOP facility. The assessment covered medical history, infectious disease risk, mental health, and vital signs.

events.title: Chronic Care Physician Evaluation
events.description: Dr. Beaudouin conducted a chronic care evaluation for Epstein, assessing and prescribing medication for conditions including hyperlipidemia, neuralgia, back pain, and constipation.

events.title: Follow-up Chronic Care Visit
events.description: Dr. Beaudouin conducted another chronic care visit with Epstein, continuing management of his hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, and back pain, and ordering laboratory tests.

events.title: Comprehensive Physical Examination
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein undergoes a detailed physical examination by provider Joaquin, Y. MLP at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The exam covers eyes, ears, nose, mouth, cranial nerves, neck, cardiovascular, abdominal, extremities, reflexes, and skin. He is prescribed Bisacodyl for constipation.

events.title: Diagnosis of Multiple Conditions and CPAP Order
events.description: Dr. Robert Beaudouin diagnoses Epstein with essential hypertension and prediabetes, orders regular insulin on a sliding scale, and provides a Philips Respironics CPAP machine for sleep apnea.

events.title: Medical Transfer Preparation
events.description: Registered Nurse Joseph Columbo completes a 'Inmate Local Hospital' transfer form, summarizing Epstein's health problems, medications, pending appointments, and restrictions (including lower bunk and fish allergies) for potential transfer.

events.title: Medical Duty Status Authorization
events.description: Epstein's medical duty status is documented, confining him to his living quarters except for meals, pill line, and treatments, with restrictions on sports and exercise.

events.title: Dental Health Screening
events.description: Epstein undergoes a comprehensive dental health history screening and A&O exam, revealing various health problems and dental observations.

events.title: Missed Dental Appointment
events.description: A dental screening encounter is noted as not done because Epstein, despite several call-outs, was not escorted to the dental clinic.

events.title: Blood Work Collection
events.description: Blood is collected from Epstein for comprehensive chemistry, hematology, and serology tests, with results reported on July 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch according to the inmate history record.

events.title: Suicide Watch Logging Begins
events.description: Detailed 15-minute observation logs for Epstein's suicide watch commence.

events.title: Suicide Watch Logging Continues
events.description: Observation logs continue documenting Epstein's status and activities.

events.title: Final Documented Day of Suicide Watch
events.description: The last day of suicide watch observations recorded in this document set.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, departed for court and did not return. Epstein was in attorney conferences throughout the day. In the evening, IDO Nathaniel Bullock provided him a social call and reported he was in 'good spirits, nothing unusual.'

events.title: Previous Incident in Cell
events.description: Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with abrasions on his neck and knee. Descriptions of the incident varied (string vs. cloth). An incident report for 'Self-Mutilation' was written but later expunged after an SIS investigation was inconclusive.

events.title: Notifications and Investigation Launch
events.description: Following Epstein's death, a series of notifications were made: USMS (7:19 am), FBI (8:34 am), AUSA (9:00 am), Judge Berman (10:00 am), next of kin (11:00 am). The OIG and FBI arrived later in the day to investigate. Computer hard drives from the SHU were removed.

events.title: Psychological Reconstruction and Institutional Response
events.description: The BOP's psychological reconstruction team (Nagle, Hollingsworth) issued a report with findings and recommendations. Warden J. Petrucci submitted a detailed institutional response acknowledging issues and outlining corrective actions regarding housing, documentation, training, and procedures.

events.title: Efrain Reyes placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes is placed in Administrative Detention at New York MCC pending an SIS investigation and threat assessment.

events.title: Psychological SHU review for Efrain Reyes
events.description: Psychologist Elissa Miller interviews Efrain Reyes in SHU and finds no significant mental health issues, deeming him psychologically stable.

events.title: Weekly SHU reviews for Efrain Reyes
events.description: Segregation Review Official M. Rice conducts weekly reviews, each time continuing Reyes's placement in the Special Housing Unit.

events.title: Christan Blades observed with facial cuts
events.description: Inmate Christan Blades is observed in Unit 9-North with cuts to his facial area, leading to an SIS Threat Assessment and his placement in SHU.

events.title: Cellphone recovery involving Brissett and Babrow
events.description: SIS recovers a cellphone on top of inmate Lorenzo Babrow's locker, allegedly belonging to inmate Jamal A. Brissett. Both are placed in SHU.

events.title: SHU Weekly Review compiled
events.description: A comprehensive SHU Weekly Review report is dated, listing all inmates currently in the Special Housing Unit at New York MCC, including Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC and placed on suicide watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and was seen for an intake screening. Due to increased suicide risk factors, it was determined he should be placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein found with string around neck
events.description: At approximately 2am, Epstein was placed on suicide watch after being found with a string hanging around his neck. He later told staff his cellmate tried to kill him, but during assessment denied remembering the event.

events.title: Epstein makes social call to mother
events.description: Unit Manager N. Bullock escorted Epstein to make a 15-minute social phone call to his mother after he agreed to shorten his attorney visitation.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive and pronounced dead
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell. Life-saving measures were attempted, and he was transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced deceased at 7:36 a.m. The incident report lists the method as hanging/asphyxiation.

events.title: Epstein's remains transported to city morgue
events.description: Following his death, Epstein's remains were prepared at New York Presbyterian hospital, moved to the hospital morgue, and later transported to the city morgue by staff from the Office of the City Medical Examiner.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive and Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. Staff initiated life-saving measures. He was transported to a local hospital and pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. due to cardiac arrest.

events.title: Resuscitation Attempts
events.description: Medical and correctional staff performed CPR, used an AED (no shock advised), administered epinephrine and sodium bicarbonate, and paramedics intubated Epstein. Efforts continued during transport to the hospital.

events.title: Media Silence Order
events.description: Lieutenant M. Cannata instructed escorting staff not to speak to anyone or the media regarding the situation and to direct inquiries to the MCC NY Public Relations Officer.

events.title: Remains Transport to Morgue
events.description: Epstein's remains were prepared at the hospital, moved to the hospital morgue, and later transported to the city morgue by the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner staff.

events.title: Epstein's Social Phone Call
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was escorted by Unit Manager N. Bullock to the Special Housing Unit to make a 15-minute social phone call, which he stated was to his mother.

events.title: Daily Inmate Counts
events.description: Routine official inmate population counts were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, with totals around 776 inmates.

events.title: Daily Inmate Counts
events.description: Routine official inmate population counts were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
